content: Chi Xu is a first year Ph.D. student major in Computer Science and Engineering under the supervision of Prof. Qian Zhang, in HKUST. His research interests include smart healthcare, computer human interaction, software engineering. He got his bachelor’s degree from Southern University of Science and Technology in 2023. Here His Homepage
summary: Chi Xu is a first year Ph.D. student major in Computer Science and Engineering under the supervision of Prof. Qian Zhang, in HKUST. His research interests include smart healthcare, computer human interaction, software engineering.
title: Chi Xu (徐驰)

content:
Nelson Bighetti is a professor of artificial intelligence at the Stanford AI Lab. His research interests include distributed robotics, mobile computing and programmable matter. He leads the Robotic Neurobiology group, which develops self-reconfiguring robots, systems of self-organizing robots, and mobile sensor networks.

content:
Slides can be added in a few ways:
Create slides using Wowchemy’s Slides feature and link using slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Upload an existing slide deck to static/ and link using url_slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Embed your slides (e.g. Google Slides) or presentation video on this page using shortcodes. Further event details, including page elements such as image galleries, can be added to the body of this page.
title: Example Event

content:
Pulmonary rehabilitation is important for individuals with chronic respiratory conditions, such as chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), asthma, pulmonary fibrosis, and others. Here are several reasons why it is important:
Improved Respiratory Function: Pulmonary rehabilitation programs typically include exercises and techniques aimed at improving lung function and respiratory muscle strength. These exercises can help individuals breathe more efficiently, increase lung capacity, and reduce breathlessness during daily activities. By improving respiratory function, pulmonary rehabilitation can enhance overall quality of life.
Symptom Management: Chronic respiratory conditions often lead to symptoms such as shortness of breath, fatigue, and decreased exercise tolerance. Pulmonary rehabilitation programs provide strategies and techniques to manage these symptoms effectively. Through education, breathing exercises, and energy conservation techniques, individuals can learn how to better cope with their symptoms and carry out daily activities with greater ease.
Enhanced Exercise Tolerance: Regular exercise is a key component of pulmonary rehabilitation. Exercise training helps individuals build endurance, strength, and cardiovascular fitness. By gradually increasing physical activity levels under the supervision of healthcare professionals, individuals can improve their exercise tolerance and perform daily activities with less difficulty.
Psychological Well-being: Chronic respiratory conditions can have a significant impact on a person’s mental and emotional well-being. Feelings of anxiety, depression, and social isolation are common. Pulmonary rehabilitation programs often include psychological support and counseling to address these issues. By providing a supportive environment and counseling services, individuals can receive emotional support and learn strategies to cope with the psychological challenges associated with their condition.
Education and Self-Management: Pulmonary rehabilitation programs offer education on the disease process, medications, proper inhaler techniques, and lifestyle modifications. This knowledge empowers individuals to take an active role in managing their condition and make informed decisions about their health. By learning about their condition and how to manage it effectively, individuals can reduce exacerbations, hospitalizations, and improve disease control.
Multidisciplinary Approach: Pulmonary rehabilitation involves a multidisciplinary team of healthcare professionals, including pulmonologists, respiratory therapists, physiotherapists, occupational therapists, and psychologists. This collaborative approach ensures that individuals receive comprehensive care addressing their physical, emotional, and social needs. The team works together to create personalized treatment plans tailored to each individual’s specific requirements.
Overall, pulmonary rehabilitation plays a crucial role in improving the quality of life for individuals with chronic respiratory conditions. It helps individuals regain and maintain their functional abilities, manage symptoms effectively, and enhance their overall well-being. If you or someone you know has a chronic respiratory condition, it is advisable to consult a healthcare professional to determine if pulmonary rehabilitation is appropriate.
summary: Pulmonary rehabilitation is important for individuals with chronic respiratory conditions, such as chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), asthma, pulmonary fibrosis, and others.
title: Pulmonary Rehabilitation
